alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 6:18AM PST until January 19 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitaiton expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches and total ice accumulation of up to a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Odessa, Grand Coulee, Pullman, Peck, Gifford, Oakesdale, Alpowa Summit, Uniontown, Genesee, Ritzville, Clarkston, Moscow, Rosalia, La Crosse, Lewiston Grade, Creston, Lewiston, Plummer, Pomeroy, Potlatch, Tekoa, Harrington, Culdesac, Coulee City, Wilbur, Lapwai, and Colfax. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 3 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery roads and walking surfaces. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to transition to freezing rain between Midnight and 9 AM on Friday. Temperatures are expected to warm above freezing in the Lewiston-Clarkston Valley and on the Palouse Friday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse
